results.title: Pharmacovigilance of Sodium-Glucose Cotransporter-2 Inhibitors for Genital Fungal Infections and Urinary Tract Infections: A Review of the Food and Drug Administration Adverse Event Reporting System Database.
results.text_hl: A total of 348 cases related to @<m>DISEASE_Mycoses</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009181 @@@genital fungal infections@@@ were reported (2.9% of reports submitted): @CHEMICAL_dapagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C529054 @@@dapagliflozin@@@ = 53, @CHEMICAL_empagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C570240 @@@empagliflozin@@@/@CHEMICAL_Linagliptin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069476 @@@linagliptin@@@ = 6, @CHEMICAL_Canagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068896 @@@canagliflozin@@@ = 267, @CHEMICAL_Canagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068896 @@@canagliflozin@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ = 3, @CHEMICAL_empagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C570240 @@@empagliflozin@@@ = 17, and @CHEMICAL_dapagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C529054 @@@dapagliflozin@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin HCl@@@ ER = 2.

citations.NLM: Mohammad H, Borja-Hart N. Pharmacovigilance of Sodium-Glucose Cotransporter-2 Inhibitors for Genital Fungal Infections and Urinary Tract Infections: A Review of the Food and Drug Administration Adverse Event Reporting System Database. J Pharm Technol. 2018 Aug;34(4):144-148. PMID: 34860970
citations.BibTeX: @article{34860970, title={Pharmacovigilance of Sodium-Glucose Cotransporter-2 Inhibitors for Genital Fungal Infections and Urinary Tract Infections: A Review of the Food and Drug Administration Adverse Event Reporting System Database.}, author={Mohammad H and Borja-Hart N}, journal={J Pharm Technol}, volume={34}, number={4}, pages={144-148}}

results.title: Diet Modification and Metformin Have a Beneficial Effect in a Fly Model of Obesity and Mucormycosis
results.text_hl: Flies fed RF or given @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, particularly those continuously kept on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (HFD(MET)-HFD(MET)) had a lower @<m>DISEASE_Mycoses</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009181 @@@fungal@@@ burden than infected flies fed HFD without @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Shirazi F, Farmakiotis D, Yan Y, Albert N, Do KA, Kontoyiannis DP. Diet Modification and Metformin Have a Beneficial Effect in a Fly Model of Obesity and Mucormycosis PLoS One. 2014;9(9):e108635. PMID: 25268492
citations.BibTeX: @article{25268492, title={Diet Modification and Metformin Have a Beneficial Effect in a Fly Model of Obesity and Mucormycosis}, author={Shirazi F and Farmakiotis D and Yan Y and Albert N and Do KA and Kontoyiannis DP}, journal={PLoS One}, volume={9}, number={9}, pages={e108635}}

results.title: Broad defects in the energy metabolism of leukocytes underlie immunoparalysis in sepsis.
results.text_hl: Blocking metabolic pathways with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ diminished cytokine production and increased mortality in systemic @<m>DISEASE_Mycoses</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009181 @@@fungal infection@@@ in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Cheng SC, Scicluna BP, Arts RJ, Gresnigt MS, Lachmandas E, Giamarellos-Bourboulis EJ, Kox M, Manjeri GR, Wagenaars JA, Cremer OL, Leentjens J, van der Meer AJ, van de Veerdonk FL, Bonten MJ, Schultz MJ, Willems PH, Pickkers P, Joosten LA, van der Poll T, Netea MG. Broad defects in the energy metabolism of leukocytes underlie immunoparalysis in sepsis. Nat Immunol. 2016 Apr;17(4):406-13. PMID: 26950237
citations.BibTeX: @article{26950237, title={Broad defects in the energy metabolism of leukocytes underlie immunoparalysis in sepsis.}, author={Cheng SC and Scicluna BP and Arts RJ and Gresnigt MS and Lachmandas E and Giamarellos-Bourboulis EJ and Kox M and Manjeri GR and Wagenaars JA and Cremer OL and Leentjens J and van der Meer AJ and van de Veerdonk FL and Bonten MJ and Schultz MJ and Willems PH and Pickkers P and Joosten LA and van der Poll T and Netea MG}, journal={Nat Immunol}, volume={17}, number={4}, pages={406-13}}

results.title: mTOR- and HIF-1alpha-mediated aerobic glycolysis as metabolic basis for trained immunity.
results.text_hl: Inhibition of @GENE_AKT1 @GENE_207 @@@Akt@@@, @GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mTOR@@@, or @GENE_HIF1A @GENE_15251 @@@HIF-1alpha@@@ blocked monocyte induction of trained immunity, whereas the adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase activator @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ inhibited the innate immune response to @<m>DISEASE_Mycoses</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009181 @@@fungal infection@@@.

citations.NLM: Cheng SC, Quintin J, Cramer RA, Shepardson KM, Saeed S, Kumar V, Giamarellos-Bourboulis EJ, Martens JH, Rao NA, Aghajanirefah A, Manjeri GR, Li Y, Ifrim DC, Arts RJ, van der Veer BM, Deen PM, Logie C, O'Neill LA, Willems P, van de Veerdonk FL, van der Meer JW, Ng A, Joosten LA, Wijmenga C, Stunnenberg HG, Xavier RJ, Netea MG. mTOR- and HIF-1alpha-mediated aerobic glycolysis as metabolic basis for trained immunity. Science. 2014 Sep 26;345(6204):1250684. PMID: 25258083
